header.title: Privacy Policy
header.description: Your privacy is paramount to us. This policy outlines how Tab Limiter handles information when you use our browser extension and related services.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.content: Tab Limiter is designed to be a "Privacy-First" tool. We believe that your browsing habits are your business, not ours. Most of our processing happens locally on your machine, and we never sell your data to third parties.

dataCollection.title: Information We Collect
dataCollection.intro: We differentiate between "Personal Data" and "Usage Data". Here is exactly what we see:

config.title: Configuration Settings
config.description: We store your preferred tab limits and whitelist settings locally via Chrome's storage API.

telemetry.title: Extension Telemetry
telemetry.description: To improve our service, we collect anonymous usage statistics such as total tabs closed and extension version.

history.title: Browsing History
history.description: We do NOT collect, store, or transmit your URL history or the content of the pages you visit.

permissions.title: Browser Permissions
permissions.intro: To function correctly, Tab Limiter requires the following permissions from your browser:

tabs.title: "tabs"
tabs.description: Used to count active tabs and close them when the limit is exceeded.

storage.title: "storage"
storage.description: Used to save your custom settings and whitelist sync across your devices.

security.title: Data Security
security.content: While most data is local, any synchronized data is encrypted in transit and at rest. We implement industry-standard security measures to protect against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction of data.

contact.title: Questions?
contact.description: If you have any questions about our Privacy Policy or the practices of this site, please contact us:
